top_categories.workout_context: Gun Flint 44's MN North Shore, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 44 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gun Flint 44's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
When someone attacks on mN rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
57ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Gun Flint 44, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gun Flint 44, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
44 miles on mN rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on mN rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
2-minute all-out efforts on mN rolling gravel. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gun Flint 44. Train it until it feels boring.
Torque for headwinds and mN rolling gravel. When cadence drops below 70rpm, muscular strength keeps the watts up.
Smooth pedaling at 44 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gun Flint 44’s 44 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gun Flint 44 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mn rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: mn north shore, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 44 miles of mn rolling gravel in Grand Marais, Minnesota.
